title: Fix “No” button visibility, bounded evasion, and attempt escalation

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button visible immediately in the question phase with a non-overlapping initial position and correct stacking.
acceptanceCriteria: After the intro countdown ends and the question phase appears, both buttons labeled exactly “Yes” and “No” are visible at the same time without any user interaction.
The initial “No” button position does not overlap the “Yes” button and is clearly readable/visible on both desktop and mobile viewport sizes.
The “No” button is not visually hidden due to stacking order (z-index), transparency, or being positioned behind other elements.

file_operations.description: Adjust question-phase button rendering so the “No” button has a safe, non-overlapping initial position (not centered on the “Yes” button) and ensure its positioning mode is consistent from first render. Keep using the existing shadcn-ui Button component for “Yes”/“No”; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update question-phase button styles to guarantee the “No” button is not hidden by stacking order (e.g., z-index) and remains clearly visible/readable on desktop and mobile, without overlapping the “Yes” button in the default layout.

requirements.summary: Constrain the “No” button’s evasive movement to the visible bounds of the question button area.
acceptanceCriteria: On repeated hover attempts, the “No” button always remains fully within the visible bounds of the question phase button area (no clipping/off-screen).
The “No” button remains clickable/hoverable and continues to move away on hover across multiple attempts.

file_operations.description: Rework “No” button hover movement to compute a random position that stays fully within the buttons container bounds (accounting for the “No” button’s rendered width/height), using element refs/measurements rather than unconstrained percentages. Keep using the existing shadcn-ui Button component; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the question-phase buttons container defines a clear movement boundary (e.g., stable sizing and clipping/containment as needed) so the “No” button cannot move under other UI such as the fixed footer.

requirements.summary: Fix “No” attempt counter escalation so dramatic messages and shrink behavior trigger on intended attempts without stale state.
acceptanceCriteria: Dramatic messages appear consistently at the intended attempt milestones during hover attempts (e.g., 3rd, 5th, 7th+ attempt as defined by the implementation), without being delayed by one interaction.
The “No” button continues to shrink slightly after each failed hover attempt down to the defined minimum scale.

file_operations.description: Refactor the hover handler to use the incremented attempt count for message milestone checks (avoid stale state), and keep the shrink-per-attempt logic consistent down to the defined minimum scale. Keep using the existing shadcn-ui Button component; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
